componenttext: As a percentage of sales.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: Well, based upon the guidance that we've given, I would expect that our SG&A, as a percentage of sales, will be lower than they were in the fourth quarter of 2010. But someone is double checking my number. Given now the trajectory of our sales both for th
componenttext: Well, based upon the guidance that we've given, I would expect that our SG&A, as a percentage of sales, will be lower than they were in the fourth quarter of 2010. But someone is double checking my number. Given now the trajectory of our sales both for the year, we will come in lower as a percentage of sales.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then lastly is if you can give a little bit more detail on sort of the inventory pull-through or the restocking in the Aeropower segment. Can you give us a little bit more color in terms of the magnitude of restocking and your best guess?
componenttext: And then lastly is if you can give a little bit more detail on sort of the inventory pull-through or the restocking in the Aeropower segment. Can you give us a little bit more color in terms of the magnitude of restocking and your best guess?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: It's hard to do. It wasn't just in Aeropower, and the basic Machinery & Equipment areas as well would be significant ramp-up of production levels around. Since the customers and all of these thousands of Pall customers are ordering to their new levels of
componenttext: It's hard to do. It wasn't just in Aeropower, and the basic Machinery & Equipment areas as well would be significant ramp-up of production levels around. Since the customers and all of these thousands of Pall customers are ordering to their new levels of production, it's really hard to parse out which is specifically for inventory.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: If I look at, for example, Boeing 787, I'm assuming you're part of that as well.
componenttext: If I look at, for example, Boeing 787, I'm assuming you're part of that as well.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: Yes.
componenttext: Yes.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: And so, my understanding is that there was some pull forward on the 787, and that might slow down a little bit in the second quarter and then tick up in the second half. Is that kind of consistent with what you've seen and what you expect or is there some
componenttext: And so, my understanding is that there was some pull forward on the 787, and that might slow down a little bit in the second quarter and then tick up in the second half. Is that kind of consistent with what you've seen and what you expect or is there some difference in that?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: Yes, that wouldn't have a major pull-through for us initially. As a percentage of the airplanes operating, it's less than 1% or 787 to this point. But better example of inventory is that the -- one of the reasons we were down in Aerospace in the fourth qu
componenttext: Yes, that wouldn't have a major pull-through for us initially. As a percentage of the airplanes operating, it's less than 1% or 787 to this point. But better example of inventory is that the -- one of the reasons we were down in Aerospace in the fourth quarter is that the U.S. government deferred the purchase of spares. A lot of those orders did come through in the first quarter and that's an inventory replenishment, thus far the best example.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: So you're seeing a lot of that as a result of Gulf activity? I mean, a lot of activity in the Gulf? Replacement parts?
componenttext: So you're seeing a lot of that as a result of Gulf activity? I mean, a lot of activity in the Gulf? Replacement parts?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: No. Again, there was -- there's so much material out there, and they have to keep their planes flying whether or not there's a war, but otherwise, they deteriorate. So it's the basic run rate. We haven't seen much of a increase or a decrease based upon sp
componenttext: No. Again, there was -- there's so much material out there, and they have to keep their planes flying whether or not there's a war, but otherwise, they deteriorate. So it's the basic run rate. We haven't seen much of a increase or a decrease based upon specific military actions.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then lastly, on Microelectronics, you seem to be fairly conservative on those numbers, and I understand. But if you look back to sort of the 2008 numbers, Microelectronics, you're above your first quarter numbers in 2008. Is there any reason why you c
componenttext: And then lastly, on Microelectronics, you seem to be fairly conservative on those numbers, and I understand. But if you look back to sort of the 2008 numbers, Microelectronics, you're above your first quarter numbers in 2008. Is there any reason why you cannot trend above for the next three quarters doing the same?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: It really is going to depend on specifically the rate of IC production and more to the point of investment in new fabs. There are a number of new fabs that Intel, Samsung and one of other foundry company have talked about, but those are more like in the n
componenttext: It really is going to depend on specifically the rate of IC production and more to the point of investment in new fabs. There are a number of new fabs that Intel, Samsung and one of other foundry company have talked about, but those are more like in the nine-months out. So we'll see. It's possible that we will outperform, that's why we put particular focus to that issue.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: Your last question comes from the line of Rob Mason with R.W. Baird.
componenttext: Your last question comes from the line of Rob Mason with R.W. Baird.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: Lisa, I did want to circle back to your update to the 2011 sales guidance. You still framed it as up, mid- to high single-digit. That strikes me as that's similar to where we were plus 6% to 9%, so not much change there. Is that fair?
componenttext: Lisa, I did want to circle back to your update to the 2011 sales guidance. You still framed it as up, mid- to high single-digit. That strikes me as that's similar to where we were plus 6% to 9%, so not much change there. Is that fair?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: It's fair, although maybe it's picked up to 7% to 9%.
componenttext: It's fair, although maybe it's picked up to 7% to 9%.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: Because you did point out several areas that were stronger. Within the overall guidance, were there any subsegments that you reduced your outlook, or anywhere sales maybe get pushed out?
componenttext: Because you did point out several areas that were stronger. Within the overall guidance, were there any subsegments that you reduced your outlook, or anywhere sales maybe get pushed out?

componenttext: No.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010

componenttext: And then, Eric, I think you mentioned, just to go back to Aeropower, the CH-47 orders did not come in. Were you specifically saying we've taken those out of the guidance for the year?

componenttext: Yes.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: But we're still expecting a better Aeropower? And is that mainly off the strength we saw in Q1?
componenttext: But we're still expecting a better Aeropower? And is that mainly off the strength we saw in Q1?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: All the backlog is good, very good in Aeropower as well, so we have good visibility there unlike Microelectronics.
componenttext: All the backlog is good, very good in Aeropower as well, so we have good visibility there unlike Microelectronics.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: And then, I guess last question, coming out of last quarter, you talked about Europe generally seeing better order trends there and it did flip to positive growth in the quarter. But how are you thinking about Europe for the balance of the year overall?
componenttext: And then, I guess last question, coming out of last quarter, you talked about Europe generally seeing better order trends there and it did flip to positive growth in the quarter. But how are you thinking about Europe for the balance of the year overall?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: We believe Europe is going to continue to slowly improve. So I think it was 5% this quarter. We'll see -- I think it will be eking up. We don't see it getting worse.
componenttext: We believe Europe is going to continue to slowly improve. So I think it was 5% this quarter. We'll see -- I think it will be eking up. We don't see it getting worse.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: So 5% might be a good way to think about Europe for the year as well?
componenttext: So 5% might be a good way to think about Europe for the year as well?

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: I think so, yes.
componenttext: I think so, yes.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010
componenttextpreview: And at this time, there are no further questions. I would like to turn the call back to Mr. Krasnoff for closing remarks.
componenttext: And at this time, there are no further questions. I would like to turn the call back to Mr. Krasnoff for closing remarks.

headline: Pall Corp., Q1 2011 Earnings Call, Dec 10, 2010

componenttext: Good. Thank you for participating this morning and for your interest. Please put March 10 and 11 on your calendars for our second quarter results. We'll release on the 10 after the market closes, as followed by our conference call the next morning at 8:30 a.m. And we look forward to doing that. Thank you very much.
